author: Peter Darwen
title: Walking with my mother
description: Peter recounts his first walks around Diglis, and how the space opened up with the opening of the walking bridge.

author: Lilliana Veronik Mazzocchi
title: After school hangout
description: Lilliana has some of her fondest memories of spending time with friends around the play area in Diglis fields.

author: Nicky Boraston
title: My car wasn't where I left it
description: Nicky recalls a rude awakening to find her car in neither the place nor the state she left it in.

author: Rupert Breakspear
title: Treasures in the nature reserve
description: Rupert talks about the rare species he's come across while strolling through the nature reserve.

author: Debbie Bourne
title: What draws us to Diglis
description: Debbie explains how she was originally drawn to the fields for her dog, but stays for the other benefits!

author: Minty White
title: Lockdown walks with Bertie
description: Minty and Bertie got to know their community through the lockdown of 2020, and made many friends in the process.

author: Hayley Bretherton
title: Walking the dog opens up Diglis
description: Haley explains how having a dog opened up parts of Diglis she'd never explored before.

author: Sarah Gateley
title: Diglis as a garden
description: Sarah talks about being without a garden when first living in Diglis, and how the fields filled that gap.

author: Claire Cale
title: Social work drive-through
description: Claire first came across Diglis while visiting as a social worker, and she liked what she saw!

author: James Roe
title: Long walks to play football
description: James remembers long walks to football games becoming shorter thanks to the walking bridge.

author: Serdar 'Smokey' Duman
title: Forming a football club
description: When Smokey was new to Worcester he formed a football club in Diglis to bring his community together.

author: Jon Elger
title: Social strolling
description: Jon walked through Diglis on several occasions to get to and from friends' boats and parties.

author: Sheila Marshall
title: Unlocking Diglis in lockdown
description: Sheila hadn't really explored Diglis until lockdown (and bright sunshine) shone a spotlight on it.

author: Sara Hayward & Paul Powis
title: Raising a family in Diglis
description: Sara and Paul talk about their time as a young family, and the changes in Diglis that happened over that time.

author: Gareth Cummings
title: The force was strong in that one
description: Gareth remembers his dad sharing a fun 'fact' about a nearby industrial unit.

author: Jan Hardie
title: I'll just get my crocs
description: Jan recalls receiving a heroic call to action to protect the park and its residents.

author: Jonathan Davies
title: Train rides
description: Jonathan talks about his dad Peter remembering his time riding the train in Diglis.

author: Sue Need
title: Quiet walks together
description: Sue talks about sharing quiet walks round the nature reserve with her husband.

author: Steph Asquith
title: Lilly's first park run
description: Steph remembers walking her first dog for the first time off-lead.

author: Trisha Connell
title: History came to life in lockdown
description: Trisha contrasts fighting through nature to reach the riverside years ago with her recent foray in lockdown into DIglis history.

author: Brian Griffiths
title: Walking to work was an adventure
description: Brian walked to work through floodwaters across Diglis fields, in a time before its development.

author: Sarah Colloby
title: Planting damson trees
description: Sarah looks forward to a time when she can pick fruit from the community trees she planted in Diglis.

author: Lucy Dennison
title: Circular walks were a lifeline
description: Lucy has fond memories of meeting with her friend Jackie in lockdown for circular walks around the field.

author: Marie-Claire Wattison
title: Emergency landing
description: Marie-Claire looks back to a time when a hot air balloon made an emergency landing.
